results.title: Home country
results.creator_credit: Julie Mongta-Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Julie Mongta/Saunders traces the movement of her family over time, both geographically and generationally. Though scattered, this family have a strong connection, both to each other and the land of their birth, intensified by the sense of ‘coming home’.

results.title: Home care
results.brief_description: Based upon the experience of Montefiore Hospital, New York, this film depicts home care programs as an effective approach toward the treatment of patients with chronic disease, and shows such are of patients with cancer, heart disease, asthma, arthritis and other conditions. Discusses factors considered in the selection of patients for home care and the role of the doctor, nurse and social worker in the treatment.

results.title: Home at seven
results.creator_credit: Eric Muller, Paul Gray, Vauxhall Motors Film Unit and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The reliability of the modern British motor-car owes much to the skill of the designers and engineers associated with the development of a new model. Describes the design, manufacture, and testing of Vauxhall cars, with emphasis on reliable performance under hard, daily motoring conditions. Skills involved in preparing for a mass production run are also illustrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Muller, Paul Gray, Vauxhall Motors Film Unit and British Information Services

results.title: Home and school
results.creator_credit: Gerry Bryant, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: The story of two typical well-meaning parents who provide everything they possibly can for the physical well-being of their children; consequently, they fail to understand why their children are so often disobedient, defiant, and generally unmanageable. In desperation, the mother seeks the advice of the headmistress of the children’s school; both parents later attend a meeting of the Parents and Teachers Association, and learn something of the methods and aims of modern education. They apply what they have learned to their relationships with their own children, with gratifying results.

results.title: Home and dry (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A brief explanation of incontinence, its causes and treatment. Discusses how it may be managed and how it can often be cured. The majority of suferers have “disorders of nervous control of micturition”. Incontinence is a common presenting symptom of disease in old age.

results.title: Home and beauty
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “This Modern Age”.
This film gives a survey of homes in Britain from Georgian times until today, tracing in particular the development of style and decoration.

results.title: Home and away (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
The most important event in the life of most five year olds is starting school. With this comes a widening of relationships to include teachers and friends. It is not always an easy step and some children are disturbed by it.

results.title: Home and Away
results.brief_description: Home and Away is with us each day… well at least each weekday. Set in Summer Bay, this frothy soap has been a stalwart of Australian screens and one of its longest-running shows, as well as a launchpad for its stars.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1980s
constellations_other.description: Australian television in the 80s really began to find its footing with mainstream hits becoming landmarks of the industry.

results.description: Home and Away is set in the fictional town of Summer Bay, a coastal town in New South Wales, and follows the personal and professional lives of the people living in the area. The show initially focused on the Fletcher family, Pippa and Tom Fletcher and their five foster children Frank Morgan, Carly Morris, Steven Matheson, Lynn Davenport and Sally Keating, who would go on to become one of the show’s longest-running characters. The show also originally and currently focuses on the Stewart family. During the early 2000s, the central storylines focused on the Sutherlands and later, the Hunters. Home and Away had proved popular when it premiered in 1988 and had risen to become a hit in Australia, and after only a few weeks, the show tackled its first major and disturbing storyline, the rape of Carly Morris; it was one of the first shows to feature such storylines during the early timeslot. H&A has tackled many adult-themed and controversial storylines; something rarely found in its restricted timeslot.
description_for_label: Home and Away is set in the fictional town of Summer Bay, a coastal town in New South Wales, and follows the personal and professional lives of the people living in the area. The show initially focused on the Fletcher family, Pippa and Tom Fletcher and their five foster children Frank Morgan, Carly Morris, Steven Matheson, Lynn Davenport and Sally Keating, who would go on to become one of the show’s longest-running characters. The show also originally and currently focuses on the Stewart family. During the early 2000s, the central storylines focused on the Sutherlands and later, the Hunters. Home and Away had proved popular when it premiered in 1988 and had risen to become a hit in Australia, and after only a few weeks, the show tackled its first major and disturbing storyline, the rape of Carly Morris; it was one of the first shows to feature such storylines during the early timeslot. H&A has tackled many adult-themed and controversial storylines; something rarely found in its restricted timeslot.
